title: TYPO 14 published
content:
The bilingual Czech typographic magazine TYPO has just published its 14th issue. It is available in print to its subscribers, as well as a free PDF   
download from:   
 [http://www.magtypo.cz/english.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519211859/http:/www.magtypo.cz/english.html)   
   
The TYPO magazine is edited by Filip Bla�ek (ATypI country delegate for Czech Republic and co-organizer of the ATypI Prague 2004 conference), Pavel Ko�i�ka, Jakub Kr�, and Pavel Zelenka (ATypI Board member and co-organizer   
of the ATypI Prague 2004 conference).   
   
The current issue includes a very extensive 20-pages article on Vojt�ch Preissig as well as my shameless self-promotional 8-pages article about the upcoming version of FontLab Studio 5.   
   
Regards,   
Adam
author: twardoch

comments.content:
Stephen Coles, attached is the Italian article I wrote ;-) John Hudson, thanks for the hint, then I went to see "Turks: Journey of a Thousand Years 600-1600" arranged by the London Royal Art Academy. Regards, AS


g1016_66-68-Typotechnica05.pdf (137.6 k)

"The final Windows version will be shipped in the Spring of 2005 with the final Mac version a few months later"   
   
Hopefully the Mac version will ship by TypeCon?

When I corresponded with Fontlab recently, they said the Mac version wasn't going to be available until this fall. As in, more than a few months away. This is kind of a bummer for me, because I don't want to buy the product and then have to pay to upgrade it a few months later. Oh well!   
   
More to the point: new TYPO! I'm excited! Especially about the Preissig article. Storm has recently issued their typefaces as OpenType fonts (including the Czech type library and their versions of Preissig Antikva and Preissig 1918), for those who didn't know.
